", "enabled": true, "title": "Sum", "description": "Simple addition of two numbers" }, { "createdAt": "2023-10-10T08:49:41.3345518", "updatedAt": "2023-10-10T09:56:09.51229", "scriptId": 11, "scriptText": "import datetime
today = datetime.datetime.now().strftime('%m/%d/%Y')
print (f"Today's date is {today}")", "enabled": false, "title": "Disabled script", "description": "A disabled script, just to see how it looks on the list" }, { "createdAt": "2023-10-10T08:52:09.0489", "updatedAt": "2023-10-10T08:52:41.4563636", "scriptId": 12, "scriptText": "import os

print(os.getcwd())
", "enabled": true, "title": "Triggers an error", "description": "Triggers security error" }, { "createdAt": "2023-10-10T08:53:19.3676008", "updatedAt": "2023-10-10T09:25:30.3161507", "scriptId": 13, "scriptText": "import time

time.sleep(11)

print("done")", "enabled": true, "title": "Triggers an error 2", "description": "Triggers TimeOut error" }, { "createdAt": "2023-10-10T08:55:25.614123", "updatedAt": "2023-10-10T08:57:29.4231649", "scriptId": 14, "scriptText": "# Program to display the Fibonacci sequence up to n-th term

nterms = int(args[0])

# first two terms
n1, n2 = 0, 1
count = 0

if nterms <= 0:
	print("Please enter a positive integer")
elif nterms == 1:
	print("Fibonacci sequence upto",nterms,":")
	print(n1)
	# generate fibonacci sequence
else:
	print("Fibonacci sequence:")
	while count < nterms:
		print(n1)
		nth = n1 + n2
		# update values
		n1 = n2
		n2 = nth
		count += 1
", "enabled": true, "title": "Fibonacci", "description": "Prints a Fibonacci sequence with a number of terms equal to the input value" }, { "deletedAt": "2023-10-10T11:57:53.9771534", "createdAt": "2023-10-10T08:57:53.9771534", "updatedAt": "2023-10-10T08:57:57.5668706", "scriptId": 15, "scriptText": "", "enabled": true, "title": "Empty script", "description": "A simple empty script" }, { "createdAt": "2023-10-10T08:58:26.3159274", "updatedAt": "2023-10-10T08:58:39.4967619", "scriptId": 16, "scriptText": "import datetime
today = datetime.datetime.now().strftime('%m/%d/%Y')
print (f"Today's date is {today}")", "enabled": true, "title": "Current date 2", "description": "Print today's date" } ]
